main event: A bright, luminous oval or disk-shaped object was observed hovering and moving erratically over a rural area near Springfield, Massachusetts on July 20, 1968.
interesting points: The object appeared to be emitting a bright, pulsating light and would suddenly speed up, slow down, and hover repeatedly.
Several witnesses observed the object through binoculars and determined it was not an aircraft or any other known object.
After about 30 minutes, the object suddenly accelerated and shot straight up, disappearing rapidly from view.
A cylindrical-shaped object was also reported to have disintegrated and exploded north of Westfield, Massachusetts, confirmed by multiple independent observers.
The Air Force responded to the reports, stating the objects may have been a satellite, asteroid, or comet passing over New England, but could not conclusively identify the phenomena.
sighted object: bright, pulsating oval/disk-shaped object, cylindrical object that disintegrated
witnesses: multiple observers, including a farmer and a 14-year-old witness
photographs: no photographs included in the report
